preparation_steps: Test soil pH to 6.0-6.8 using digital meter 2-3 weeks before planting
Work 2-3 inches compost into top 8 inches soil when temperature reaches 50°F
Choose location with full sun receiving 6-8 hours direct sunlight daily
planting_steps: Start Cucumbers seeds indoors 6-8 weeks before 2025-05-10 at 70-75°F soil temperature
Sow seeds 1.0 inches deep with 12 inch spacing between plants
Transplant outdoors 2 weeks after 2025-05-10 when nighttime temperatures stay above 50°F
care_instructions: Water Cucumbers deeply 1-1.5 inches per week checking soil moisture 2 inches deep every 3 days
Apply 10-10-10 fertilizer at 2 tablespoons per plant every 3 weeks starting 2 weeks after transplant
Mulch with 2-3 inches organic matter keeping 6 inches away from plant stem
pest_management: Inspect Cucumbers weekly for common zone 4a-6a pests from May through September
Apply neem oil spray at 2 tablespoons per gallon water every 14 days if pests detected
Use floating row covers first 3 weeks after transplant to prevent early season pest damage
harvest_instructions: Begin harvesting Cucumbers approximately 55 days after transplant when fruits reach full size
Harvest in early morning 6-8 AM when temperatures below 75°F for best quality and flavor
Cut stems with clean sharp shears 1/4 inch above leaf node to encourage continued production
storage_tips: Store fresh Cucumbers at 55-60°F with 85% humidity for maximum 7-10 days after harvest
Blanch and freeze within 24 hours of harvest - maintains quality for 8-12 months in freezer
Preserve excess using canning or dehydrating methods appropriate for vegetable type

plant_groupings.spacing_notes: Plant cucumbers 12 inches apart in rows that are 3-4 feet apart

general_tips: Start cucumber seeds indoors 3-4 weeks before the last frost date to get a head start on the growing season.
Choose a variety of cucumber that is resistant to powdery mildew, which can be a problem in Moncton's cool and humid climate.
Cucumbers prefer well-draining soil with a pH between 6.0 and 7.0. Test your soil before planting to ensure it meets these conditions.
In Moncton's short growing season, use row covers or other frost protection methods to extend the cucumber harvest period.
Water cucumbers consistently, but avoid overwatering which can lead to fungal diseases. Aim for about 1 inch of water per week.
Cucumbers are a warm-season crop and prefer full sun (at least 6 hours of direct sunlight). Choose a location that receives plenty of sunlight.
